title: Personnage (No. 5)
provenance_text:
Maryan S. Maryan [1927-1997], New York, NY [1]; Allan Frumkin Gallery, New York, NY, until December 1964 [2]; purchased by Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, May 1965 [3].

Notes:
[1]. The artist was born Pinchas Burstein in Poland. He moved to New York City in the early 1960s.
[2]. The painting was no. 344 in "The 1964 Pittsburgh International Exhibition of Contemporary Painting and Sculpture" held at the Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1964 - January 1965. It was lent by Allan Frumkin Gallery, New York, NY.
[3]. The painting was purchased by Carnegie Institute from the 1964 International using the John Henry Craner Fund. Payment to Allan Frumkin Gallery was sent on December 10, 1964. The painting was accessioned later, on May 11, 1965.
